sub_topic: Probability of drawing a certain card from a deck of cards
message_1: What is the probability of drawing a King or Queen from a standard deck of 52 playing cards?
message_2:
There are 4 Kings and 4 Queens in a standard deck of 52 playing cards. So, there are a total of 8 cards that are either a King or a Queen.

The probability of drawing a King or Queen is the ratio of the number of favorable outcomes (drawing a King or Queen) to the total number of possible outcomes (drawing any card from the deck).

Probability = (Number of favorable outcomes) / (Total number of possible outcomes)

Probability = 8 (Kings and Queens) / 52 (total cards)

Probability = 2 / 13

So, the probability of drawing a King or Queen from a standard deck of 52 playing cards is 2/13 or approximately 0.1538 (rounded to four decimal places).
